intro: Peucedanum seseloides, commonly known as narrow-leaved hogweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its tall, hollow stems and large, umbrella-like inflorescences composed of small white or greenish flowers. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a silky hair layer. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. Peucedanum seseloides is known for its biennial life cycle, with the plant producing flowers and seeds in its second year.
